# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in split(text)
        # Check if adding the word exceeds the text width
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        # Add the last line if needed
        if !isempty(current_line)
            push!(lines, current_line)
        end
    # Add the last line if there's any content left
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return lines
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a sample text. It will wrap to multiple lines if the words exceed the given text_width of 10 characters."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10))
println(wrapped_text)
```

The `wrap_string` function takes a string `text` and an optional `text_width` parameter (default is 10). It iterates over each word in the text and adds a new line when the combined length of the current line and the next word exceeds the given `text_width`. The function returns an array of lines with proper line breaks.
